feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.description: Send feedback or suggestions to the team.

help.title: Help
help.description: Ask for help using this instance.

support.title: Support
support.description: Contact support about an issue or request.

errors.rateLimited: Too many messages. Please try again later.
errors.failed: Failed to send message. Please try again.

admin.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this record?
admin.confirmDeleteTypeWithFields: Delete user type "{{name}}"? This will also delete {{count}} associated field(s).

setup.title: Configure Your Instance
setup.subtitle: Customize the branding and user onboarding experience
setup.instanceSectionDesc: Set the name, icon, and colors shown across your instance.
setup.displayNameHint: This name appears in the header and onboarding screens
setup.userSectionDesc: Configure user types and the questions users answer during onboarding.
setup.userTypesHint: Define different user types to show type-specific onboarding questions. If you have more than one type, users will choose their type during onboarding.
setup.onboardingFieldsHint: Create the questions users answer during onboarding.
setup.knowledgeBaseHint: Upload documents to build your RAG knowledge base for AI-powered responses.
setup.databaseHint: View and manage your instance data directly in the SQLite database.

instanceConfig.title: Instance Configuration
instanceConfig.subtitle: Control branding, chat style, and theme settings for your instance.
instanceConfig.chatIconsDesc: Set the default icons used in chat messages.
instanceConfig.logoPreviewHint: Preview (falls back to the selected icon).
instanceConfig.faviconHint: Shown in the browser tab and bookmarks (recommended 32x32 or 64x64).
instanceConfig.appleTouchIconHint: Used when adding to the iOS home screen (recommended 180x180).
instanceConfig.headerDesc: Control how your instance appears in the top header.
instanceConfig.headerLayoutIconNameDesc: Show both the icon and instance name.
instanceConfig.headerLayoutIconOnlyDesc: Minimal header with just the icon.
instanceConfig.headerLayoutNameOnlyDesc: Text-only header with the instance name.
instanceConfig.headerTaglinePlaceholder: Short descriptor shown under the name
instanceConfig.headerTaglineHint: Leave blank to hide the tagline.
instanceConfig.chatIdentityDesc: Set the labels shown above chat messages.
instanceConfig.chatIdentityHint: Leave a label empty to hide it.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleDesc: Choose the shape and depth of chat bubbles.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleSoftDesc: Rounded corners with a subtle chat feel.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleRoundDesc: Extra-round bubbles with a friendly shape.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleSquareDesc: Sharper corners for a structured look.
instanceConfig.bubbleStylePillDesc: Full pill style for a bold look.
instanceConfig.surfaceDesc: Pick the background texture for your instance.
instanceConfig.surfaceGradientDesc: Subtle gradient glow in the background.
instanceConfig.surfaceGridDesc: Faint grid for a technical vibe.
instanceConfig.statusIconsDesc: Choose how status updates are displayed.
instanceConfig.statusIconsMinimalDesc: Compact glyphs with a light touch.
instanceConfig.typographyDesc: Pick a font pairing for the entire interface.

configAssistant.title: Admin Configuration Assistant
configAssistant.shareSecretsHint: Off by default. Enable Config tool first. When enabled, secret deployment config values are revealed client-side and sent to Maple.
configAssistant.emptyPrompt: Ask questions about any admin configuration. If you want the assistant to propose and apply changes, ask it to include a JSON change set.
configAssistant.reviewMaskedSecrets: Review: values for secret deployment keys are masked here.

reachout.title: User Reachout
reachout.subtitle: Optionally let authenticated users send a message to your team via email.
reachout.leaveBlankPlaceholder: Leave blank to use the default

help.title: Help
help.desc: Offer help with using the instance.

support.title: Support
support.desc: Offer support for issues and requests.

reachout.toEmailHint: Emails will be sent using your configured SMTP settings.
reachout.subjectPrefixHint: Optional. Prepended to the email subject line.
reachout.copyHint: Optional copy overrides. If blank, the UI uses translated defaults based on the selected framing. Overrides apply to all languages.
reachout.overrideDescriptionPlaceholder: Tell us what you need and we will reply by email.
reachout.includeIpLabel: Include masked client IP in reachout emails
reachout.includeIpHint: Disabled by default. IP addresses are personal data under GDPR. When enabled, IPs are masked (e.g. 1.2.3.0) before inclusion.

errors.toEmailRequired: Destination email is required when reachout is enabled.
errors.invalidRateLimits: Rate limits must be positive numbers.
errors.hourExceedsDay: Hourly rate limit cannot exceed daily rate limit.

userConfig.title: User Configuration
userConfig.subtitle: Configure user types and the questions users answer during onboarding.

userMigration.title: User Type Migration
userMigration.subtitle: Move users between types and let missing required fields be completed during the next onboarding step.
userMigration.visibleSelected: {{selected}} selected in current filter ({{visible}} visible users).
userMigration.noUsers: No users found for the selected filter.
userMigration.noUsersHint: Try changing the filter above or refreshing.
userMigration.alreadyTarget: User is already in the target type
userMigration.targetRequired: Select a target type before migrating users.
userMigration.selectUsers: Select at least one user to migrate.
userMigration.anonymizedHint: This user's data has been anonymized and cannot be decrypted.

database.title: Database Explorer
database.subtitle: View and manage SQLite data
database.selectTable: Select a table from the sidebar
database.decryptHelp: Connect your Nostr extension to decrypt encrypted fields in the browser.
database.decryptNoExtension: No Nostr extension detected. Install a NIP-07 extension to decrypt fields.

help.advancedWarningDesc: The database explorer gives direct access to your SQLite database. Incorrect queries can corrupt data — only use this if you know what you are doing.
help.asyncDecryptDesc: Decryption happens in the browser using your Nostr key. Large tables may take a moment to fully decrypt.
help.backupTip: Always export a backup before running any write queries.
help.deleteWarning: DELETE FROM table WHERE …; — always include a WHERE clause
help.dropWarning: DROP TABLE table; — permanently destroys the table and all its data
help.encryptedDesc: Some columns are encrypted at rest with NIP-04. The explorer can decrypt them in your browser if your Nostr extension is connected.
help.joinTables: SELECT u.pubkey, d.title FROM users u JOIN documents d ON u.id = d.user_id;
help.lockIconDesc: Indicates an encrypted column. Values are stored as ciphertext until decrypted.
help.queriesDesc: Use standard SQLite syntax. Here are some safe read-only patterns to get started.
help.rawValuesDesc: Before decryption, encrypted fields display their raw ciphertext. Click 'Unlock Decryption' to reveal plaintext.
help.sqliteNote: This explorer connects to the same SQLite file the backend uses. Changes take effect immediately.
help.updateWarning: UPDATE table SET … WHERE …; — always include a WHERE clause
help.warningsDesc: These operations are destructive and cannot be undone. Avoid running them unless you have a backup.
help.whoFor1: Admins debugging data issues or verifying encryption
help.whoFor2: Developers inspecting schema or running migrations
help.whoFor3: Advanced users exporting data for analysis

database.nip07Locked: Nostr extension locked — unlock to decrypt fields
database.nip07StatusHelp: Decryption uses your Nostr key via a NIP-07 browser extension. Connect your extension to view encrypted values.

fields.globalHint: Global fields are shown to all users. Type-specific fields only appear for that user type.
fields.placeholderHint: Hint text shown in the input
fields.dataSecurityIntro: Choose how this field's data is stored. This affects both security and AI personalization capabilities.
fields.encryptedHint: Field values will be encrypted with NIP-04 (recommended)
fields.plaintextHint: Field values will be stored in plaintext (not recommended for sensitive data)
fields.encryptedSummary: This field is encrypted. Only an admin with the corresponding Nostr private key can decrypt and view the data.
fields.encryptedNoAI: AI personalization is not available for encrypted fields.
fields.securityWarningBody: Disabling encryption will store user data in plaintext. Only disable for non-sensitive fields like preferences or public information.
fields.plaintextAIOption: Since this field is unencrypted, you can optionally share it with the AI assistant:
fields.includeInChatHint: Share this field's value with the AI assistant to personalize responses
fields.aiPersonalizationBody: The AI assistant will see this field's value to provide more relevant, personalized responses to users.
fields.encryptionHelpDesc: Encryption protects sensitive user data by scrambling it before storage.
fields.encryptionHelpPoint1: Data is encrypted using the admin's Nostr key (NIP-04)
fields.encryptionHelpPoint2: Only the admin can decrypt and view the data
fields.encryptionHelpPoint3: Reduces exposure in some database breach scenarios, but does not eliminate risk
fields.encryptionHelpPoint4: Cannot be shared with the AI assistant
fields.encryptionHelpDisabledPoint1: Data is stored as readable plaintext
fields.encryptionHelpDisabledPoint2: Anyone with database access can read it
fields.encryptionHelpDisabledPoint3: Can be shared with AI for personalization
fields.encryptionHelpRecommendation: Recommendation: Keep encryption enabled for any personally identifiable information (names, emails, phone numbers, addresses).
fields.complianceAcknowledgeLabel: I confirm this field can be stored in plaintext and/or shared with AI under our applicable legal requirements.
fields.complianceAcknowledgeHint: Enable this only after updating your user notices, consent flows (if required), and internal data-handling policies.
fields.complianceAcknowledgeRequired: You must confirm legal/compliance responsibility before saving this field configuration.

errors.saveFailed: Failed to save settings. Please try again.

userHelp.fieldCheckbox: Checkbox — a true/false toggle, useful for consent or opt-in flags
userHelp.fieldDate: Date — a date picker for birthdays, start dates, etc.
userHelp.fieldNumber: Number — numeric input for age, employee ID, etc.
userHelp.fieldSelect: Select — dropdown with predefined options you define
userHelp.fieldText: Text — single-line input for names, titles, or short values
userHelp.fieldTextarea: Textarea — multi-line input for bios, notes, or descriptions
userHelp.fieldsDesc: Each field has a name, type, and can be marked as required. Fields can be applied globally (all user types) or only to specific types.
userHelp.overviewDesc: User configuration lets you define user types and custom fields to collect structured information about your users.
userHelp.overviewNote: Changes to user types and fields take effect immediately for new registrations.
userHelp.tipGlobalDesc: Fields applied globally appear on every user type. Use them for information you always need, like display name or email.
userHelp.tipOrderDesc: Drag fields to reorder them. The order here is the order users see during registration and on their profile.
userHelp.tipRequiredDesc: Mark fields as required only when you truly need the data. Too many required fields can discourage sign-ups.
userHelp.tipsDesc: Keep these in mind when setting up your user configuration.
userHelp.twoTier: Sanctum uses a two-tier system: User Types define categories of users, and User Fields define what data each type collects.
userHelp.typesDesc: Create user types when you need different registration forms or permissions for different groups.
userHelp.typesExample: Example: A university might create 'Student', 'Faculty', and 'Staff' types, each with their own fields.
userHelp.useCase1: Different registration forms for students vs faculty
userHelp.useCase3: Separate onboarding flows for internal and external users
userHelp.userFieldsExplain: Custom data fields attached to user profiles. Each field has a type (text, email, select, etc.) and can be required or optional.
userHelp.userTypesExplain: Categories that group users together. Each type can have its own set of required fields and permissions.

adminOnboarding.title: Admin Setup
adminOnboarding.subtitle: Connect with your Nostr identity to manage this instance
adminOnboarding.installExtension: Install a NIP-07 compatible extension to continue
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyIntro: After connecting with Nostr, follow this simple setup path:
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyStep1: Secure access: set public URLs, disable simulation flags outside development, and choose user approval rules.
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyStep2: Set data boundaries: collect only needed fields, keep sensitive fields encrypted, and limit chat context fields.
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyStep3: Validate and monitor: run config validation, check service health, and review stored data regularly.
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyNote: This gives you a strong baseline for production.
adminOnboarding.legalResponsibilityNotice: You are responsible for lawful configuration, user disclosures, and data-handling policies for this instance.

nostr.whatIsNostrDesc: Nostr is a decentralized protocol for social networking and identity. Unlike traditional logins, your identity isn't controlled by any company — you own your keys.
nostr.whatIsNip07Desc: NIP-07 is a standard that lets websites request your Nostr public key from a browser extension. This means:
nostr.step1: Install a Nostr signing extension (we recommend Alby)
nostr.step3: Approve the connection in your extension
nostr.dontHaveExtension: Don't have a Nostr extension? Get one here:

userType.title: What describes you best?
userType.description: Select the option that best fits your needs
userType.loadError: Failed to load user types. Please try again.

language.title: Choose your language
language.subtitle: Select your preferred language to continue
language.changeInSettings: You can change this later in your settings.

auth.welcomeBackSubtitle: Sign in to continue where you left off
auth.magicLinkHelp: We'll send you a magic link to sign in — no password needed.
auth.sentMagicLink: We sent a magic link to
auth.clickLink: Click the link in the email to sign in.
auth.checkSpam: Don't see it? Check your spam folder.
auth.noPasswordBody: You sign in with a one-time link, so there is no password database to manage.
auth.expiringLinkBody: Each magic link is signed and expires after 15 minutes.
auth.encryptionBody: Profile fields are encrypted by default, but this instance administrator controls field-level settings and may allow selected data to be stored or shared differently.
auth.adminControlNotice: Data handling is configured by this instance administrator, including what may be stored unencrypted or shared with AI tools.
auth.retentionNotice: Data retention and deletion timelines are set by this instance administrator. Contact them for access, correction, or deletion requests.
auth.noWarrantyNotice: Sanctum software is provided as-is without warranty. Use of this instance is subject to administrator policies.

verify.pleaseWait: Just a moment while we sign you in.
verify.linkExpiredMessage: This magic link may have expired or already been used.

profile.title: Complete Your Profile
profile.subtitle: Just a few more details to get started

pending.title: Pending Approval
pending.heading: Your account is pending approval
pending.message: An administrator will review your registration and approve your access.

emptyState.title: What would you like to know?
emptyState.description: Ask questions about your knowledge base or start a general conversation

suggestedPrompts.documents: What documents are in the knowledge base?
suggestedPrompts.ragPipeline: How does the RAG pipeline work?
suggestedPrompts.entities: What are the main entities and relationships?

tools.label: Tools
tools.webSearch: Search the web for current information

documentScope.title: Knowledge Bases
documentScope.description: Select sources to include in context

adminDashboard.title: Admin Dashboard
adminDashboard.subtitle: Manage your Sanctum instance configuration
adminDashboard.configureSubtitle: These sections control branding, user data collection, AI behavior, deployment security, and stored content.
adminDashboard.securityStep1Body: Set public URLs, disable simulation flags outside development, and choose whether users require approval.
adminDashboard.securityStep2Body: Collect only necessary fields, keep sensitive fields encrypted, and only include safe fields in chat context.
adminDashboard.securityStep3Body: Validate configuration, check service health, secure email and HTTPS settings, and review stored records regularly.
adminDashboard.instanceDesc: Branding, chat style, and theme settings
adminDashboard.userDesc: Define user types and onboarding questions
adminDashboard.aiDesc: Configure prompts, LLM parameters, and document defaults
adminDashboard.deploymentDesc: Manage environment settings and service health
adminDashboard.uploadDesc: Add documents to your knowledge base
adminDashboard.databaseDesc: Browse and query the SQLite database

adminAI.title: AI Configuration
adminAI.subtitle: Control how the AI behaves and responds to your users
adminAI.promptTemplateDesc: Shape how the AI communicates with your users
adminAI.promptTemplateHint: These settings define the AI's personality and boundaries. Changes take effect immediately for new conversations.
adminAI.parametersHint: These technical settings affect response speed and quality. The defaults work well for most use cases — only adjust if you notice issues.
adminAI.sessionDefaultsDesc: Set which features are on by default
adminAI.sessionDefaultsHint: Control which AI capabilities are enabled when users start a new chat session.
adminAI.documentDefaultsDesc: Control which documents the AI can reference
adminAI.documentDefaultsHint: Documents marked "Available" can be selected by users. Documents marked "Active by Default" are automatically included in new conversations.
adminAI.overrideHint: Override the global default for this user type only.

parametersHelp.balanced: Balanced — good for most RAG use cases
parametersHelp.creative: Creative — more varied, sometimes surprising answers
parametersHelp.defaultNote: The defaults work well for most knowledge-base Q&A. Only adjust if you have a specific reason.
parametersHelp.deterministic: Deterministic — same input always gives the same output
parametersHelp.maxTokensDesc: Maximum number of tokens the model can generate in a single response. Higher values allow longer answers but use more resources.
parametersHelp.overviewDesc: These settings control how the AI model generates responses. They affect creativity, length, and consistency.
parametersHelp.samplingNote: Adjusting both top_p and top_k simultaneously can produce unpredictable results. Change one at a time.
parametersHelp.temp0: 0.0 — Fully deterministic, always picks the most likely token
parametersHelp.tempHigh: 0.8–1.0 — Creative and varied, may introduce hallucinations
parametersHelp.tempMid: 0.3–0.7 — Balanced, suitable for most RAG tasks
parametersHelp.temperatureDesc: Temperature controls randomness. Lower values make responses more focused and predictable; higher values make them more creative and varied.
parametersHelp.tip1: Responses feel too generic or repetitive → raise temperature slightly
parametersHelp.tip2: Responses contain hallucinated facts → lower temperature toward 0
parametersHelp.tip3: Answers are cut off mid-sentence → increase max tokens
parametersHelp.tip4: You want consistent, reproducible results → set temperature to 0
parametersHelp.tokensDesc: These settings limit the token sampling pool. They are advanced — the defaults are fine for most setups.
parametersHelp.topKDesc: top_k — limits sampling to the top K most probable tokens. Lower values are more focused. Set to 0 to disable.
parametersHelp.topPDesc: top_p — limits sampling to the smallest set of tokens whose cumulative probability exceeds P. Lower values are more focused.

promptHelp.contextPlaceholder: {context} — replaced with retrieved knowledge-base chunks relevant to the query
promptHelp.contextTemplateDesc: Wraps the retrieved context before it is injected into the query. Use this to add instructions around the context block.
promptHelp.historyPlaceholder: {history} — replaced with recent conversation messages for multi-turn context
promptHelp.overviewDesc: Prompt templates are the instructions sent to the AI model. They control how the model interprets context, answers questions, and maintains its persona.
promptHelp.placeholdersDesc: Placeholders are replaced with real data at query time. Use them in your templates to inject dynamic content.
promptHelp.placeholdersNote: All placeholders are optional. If a placeholder has no data (e.g., no history), it is replaced with an empty string.
promptHelp.previewTip: Use the prompt preview below the editor to see how your template looks with sample data before saving.
promptHelp.queryPlaceholder: {query} — replaced with the user's current question
promptHelp.queryTemplateDesc: The main prompt sent to the model for each query. This is where you combine context, history, and the user's question.
promptHelp.risky1: Removing {context} — the model will not see retrieved knowledge and may hallucinate
promptHelp.risky2: Removing {query} — the model will not see the user's question
promptHelp.risky3: Adding instructions that conflict with the system prompt
promptHelp.safe1: Adjusting the tone or persona in the system prompt
promptHelp.safe2: Adding formatting instructions (e.g., 'respond in bullet points')
promptHelp.safe3: Adding domain-specific instructions (e.g., 'you are a legal assistant')
promptHelp.safe4: Changing the language of instructions to match your users
promptHelp.systemPromptDesc: Sets the AI's persona and base behavior. This is sent once at the start of every conversation.
promptHelp.tipsDesc: Not all changes are equal. Some are safe to experiment with, others can break your RAG pipeline.
promptHelp.userInfoPlaceholder: {user_info} — replaced with the current user's profile fields, if available

adminDeployment.title: Deployment Configuration
adminDeployment.subtitle: Manage your server connections and infrastructure settings
adminDeployment.serviceHealthHint: Green means the service is responding normally. If a service shows red, check its configuration below.
adminDeployment.validationStaleDesc: Configuration changed since last validation. Revalidate to confirm.
adminDeployment.leaveEmptyForSecret: Leave empty to keep current value

domainsHelp.overviewDesc: These settings control where your app lives on the internet and how services find each other. Defaults are set for local development.
domainsHelp.whatToSet: Set these when you go live:
domainsHelp.overviewUrl: INSTANCE_URL / API_BASE_URL / ADMIN_BASE_URL for public entry points
domainsHelp.overviewCORS: CORS_ORIGINS to allow your frontend domain
domainsHelp.overviewNote: If you are staying on localhost, you can keep the defaults.
domainsHelp.urlsDesc: Public URLs and CORS origins must match exactly (scheme + domain + port).
domainsHelp.urlsNote: If your API is served from the same domain as the app, you can leave API_BASE_URL empty.
domainsHelp.dnsDesc: These values help you create DNS records for email deliverability.
domainsHelp.dkimExample: Use the selector from DKIM_SELECTOR and the public key from your provider.
domainsHelp.dmarcExample: Example TXT record: v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:dmarc@example.com
domainsHelp.dnsNote: Use your email provider's recommended records for best deliverability.
domainsHelp.cdnDesc: Comma-separated CDN hostnames for static assets. Leave blank if not using a CDN.
domainsHelp.webhookDesc: Base URL used to construct webhook callbacks. Use your public API domain.
domainsHelp.searxDesc: Only needed if your SearXNG instance lives on a different host.

emailHelp.brevoHint: Use your Brevo SMTP credentials. Find them under Settings → SMTP & API in the Brevo dashboard.
emailHelp.gmailHint: Use an App Password — not your regular Gmail password. Enable 2FA first, then generate an App Password in your Google Account security settings.
emailHelp.mailgunHint: Use your Mailgun SMTP credentials from the domain settings page. The host is typically smtp.mailgun.org.
emailHelp.mockSmtp: MOCK_SMTP — when enabled, emails are logged to the console instead of being sent. Useful for development.
emailHelp.overviewDesc: Configure SMTP settings to enable outbound email (invitations, notifications, password resets). All providers use standard SMTP fields.
emailHelp.postmarkHint: Use your Postmark Server API token as the SMTP password. The SMTP username is always the same token.
emailHelp.sendgridHint: Use 'apikey' as the SMTP username and your SendGrid API key as the password. The host is smtp.sendgrid.net.
emailHelp.sesHint: Use your AWS SES SMTP credentials (not your IAM keys). Generate them in the SES console under SMTP Settings.
emailHelp.smtpFrom: SMTP_FROM — the 'From' address on outgoing emails (e.g., noreply@example.com)
emailHelp.smtpHost: SMTP_HOST — your email provider's SMTP server (e.g., smtp.sendgrid.net)
emailHelp.smtpPass: SMTP_PASS — SMTP password or API key, depending on the provider
emailHelp.smtpPort: SMTP_PORT — usually 587 (STARTTLS) or 465 (SSL). Use 587 unless your provider specifies otherwise.
emailHelp.smtpUser: SMTP_USER — SMTP username, often your email address or an API key name

embeddingHelp.cacheDesc: HF_HUB_OFFLINE / TRANSFORMERS_OFFLINE — when enabled, the model is loaded only from the local cache. No internet requests are made.
embeddingHelp.e5Desc: intfloat/multilingual-e5-base — 768 dimensions, good balance of speed and accuracy. Supports 100+ languages.
embeddingHelp.e5LargeDesc: intfloat/multilingual-e5-large — 1024 dimensions, highest accuracy but slower and uses more memory.
embeddingHelp.e5SmallDesc: intfloat/multilingual-e5-small — 384 dimensions, fastest and lightest. Good for resource-constrained environments.
embeddingHelp.modelPerfDesc: Larger models produce more accurate results but require more memory and time. Choose based on your hardware.
embeddingHelp.modelsDesc: Sanctum supports three multilingual E5 embedding models. All run locally — no data leaves your server.
embeddingHelp.overviewDesc: Embeddings convert text into numerical vectors for semantic search. Sanctum uses a local embedding model to process documents and queries.
embeddingHelp.overviewNote: Changing the embedding model requires re-ingesting all documents so vectors are consistent.
embeddingHelp.performanceDesc: These settings control model loading behavior and can affect startup time and resource usage.
embeddingHelp.step1: A document is uploaded and split into chunks
embeddingHelp.step2: Each chunk is passed through the embedding model
embeddingHelp.step3: The model produces a numerical vector for each chunk
embeddingHelp.step4: Vectors are stored in Qdrant for fast similarity search
embeddingHelp.warning: Switching models invalidates all existing vectors. You must re-ingest your documents after changing this setting.

keyMigration.confirmWarning: This will re-encrypt all data with the new admin key. The old key will no longer be able to decrypt instance data. Make sure you have access to the new key before proceeding.
keyMigration.decryptFailed: Failed to decrypt user data with the current key.
keyMigration.decryptFieldFailed: Failed to decrypt field — it may have been encrypted with a different key.
keyMigration.description: Migrate your instance encryption from one Nostr key to another. All encrypted fields and user data will be re-encrypted with the new key.
keyMigration.doNotClose: Do not close this window while migration is in progress.
keyMigration.hint: You will be asked to decrypt data with your current key and re-encrypt with the new one. Both keys must be accessible via your Nostr extension.
keyMigration.invalidPubkey: Invalid public key. Enter a valid hex or npub-format Nostr public key.
keyMigration.noExtension: No Nostr extension detected. Install a NIP-07 browser extension (e.g., Alby, nos2x) to proceed.
keyMigration.noNip04: Your Nostr extension does not support NIP-04 encryption, which is required for key migration.
keyMigration.prepareFailed: Failed to prepare migration. Check that both keys are valid and your extension is connected.
keyMigration.pubkeyHint: Enter the hex or npub public key of the new admin.
keyMigration.samePubkey: The new key is the same as the current admin key. Enter a different key to migrate.
keyMigration.signInPrompt: Sign in with your current admin key to begin the migration.
keyMigration.title: Key Migration
keyMigration.warning: This is an advanced operation. Incorrect migration can lock you out of encrypted data. Proceed only if you understand the implications.

adminDeployment.leaveEmptyForLlmApiKey: Leave empty to clear override and use .env MAPLE_API_KEY fallback.

llmHelp.apiKeyField: LLM_API_KEY — your Maple API key. Maps to MAPLE_API_KEY.
llmHelp.mapleExtra: Set LLM_API_KEY to your Maple key from trymaple.ai. LLM_* keys map to MAPLE_* aliases.
llmHelp.mapleHint: Maple is the standard LLM backend for Sanctum.
llmHelp.modelField: LLM_MODEL — Maple model identifier (for example: kimi-k2-5).
llmHelp.ollamaExtra: Legacy key retained for translation compatibility. Use Maple settings above.
llmHelp.ollamaHint: Reserved for legacy docs. Sanctum runtime is Maple-only.
llmHelp.overviewDesc: Sanctum uses Maple as its standard LLM service. Maple provides an OpenAI-compatible API under the hood.

adminDeployment.revealFailed: Failed to reveal the value. Check your Nostr extension connection.

searchHelp.configDesc: Point SEARXNG_URL to your SearXNG instance. The default works if SearXNG is running in the Docker Compose stack.
searchHelp.configNote: If you changed the SearXNG container name or port, update this URL to match.
searchHelp.overviewDesc: Web search lets the AI supplement knowledge-base answers with live results from the internet, powered by SearXNG.
searchHelp.overviewNote: Web search is optional. If disabled, the AI only uses your ingested documents.
searchHelp.overviewWhen: Enable web search when your knowledge base may not cover current events or rapidly changing topics.
searchHelp.privacyDesc: SearXNG is a privacy-respecting metasearch engine. It aggregates results from multiple search engines without tracking users.
searchHelp.privacyWarning: When web search is enabled, queries are sent to external search engines via SearXNG. No user-identifying data is included, but the query text itself leaves your server.
searchHelp.privacyWhen: If full query privacy is critical, keep web search disabled and rely solely on your local knowledge base.

securityHelp.devDesc: These flags bypass real authentication and let you access the app without a Nostr key. They exist only for local development and testing.
securityHelp.devWarning: Never enable simulation flags in production. They disable all authentication checks and expose admin endpoints to anyone.
securityHelp.frontendDesc: FRONTEND_URL tells the backend where the frontend is hosted, used for CORS, redirects, and cookie scoping.
securityHelp.frontendNote: This must match exactly — including scheme (http/https) and port. Mismatches cause CORS errors.
securityHelp.frontendWhen: Set this when deploying behind a custom domain or changing the frontend port.
securityHelp.overviewDesc: Security settings control authentication, session handling, and development shortcuts. Defaults are configured for local development.
securityHelp.overviewNote: In production, make sure simulation flags are off and FRONTEND_URL matches your real domain.
securityHelp.overviewWhen: Review these settings before deploying to a public-facing server.
securityHelp.simAdminDesc: SIMULATE_ADMIN_AUTH — bypasses admin authentication. All requests are treated as coming from an admin user.
securityHelp.simUserDesc: SIMULATE_USER_AUTH — bypasses user authentication. All requests are treated as coming from a logged-in user.

sslHelp.certsDesc: SSL_CERT_PATH and SSL_KEY_PATH point to your TLS certificate and private key files inside the container.
sslHelp.certsWhen: Only set these if the backend terminates TLS directly. If you use a reverse proxy (Nginx, Caddy, Traefik), handle TLS there instead.
sslHelp.forceDesc: FORCE_HTTPS — redirects all HTTP requests to HTTPS. Enable this in production to ensure all traffic is encrypted.
sslHelp.hstsDesc: HSTS_MAX_AGE — tells browsers to always use HTTPS for this domain, in seconds. Set to 0 to disable. A typical value is 31536000 (1 year).
sslHelp.httpsDesc: These settings control HTTPS enforcement and security headers.
sslHelp.httpsWhen: Enable FORCE_HTTPS and set HSTS once your TLS certificates are working correctly.
sslHelp.monitoringDesc: MONITORING_URL — an optional URL for health-check monitoring services. Excluded from HTTPS redirect to allow plain-HTTP probes.
sslHelp.overviewDesc: SSL settings control HTTPS behavior, certificate paths, and proxy trust. Defaults are configured for local HTTP development.
sslHelp.overviewNote: If you deploy behind a reverse proxy that handles TLS, you may not need to configure these at all.
sslHelp.overviewWhen: Configure these when deploying to production with HTTPS, or when placing Sanctum behind a TLS-terminating proxy.
sslHelp.proxiesDesc: TRUSTED_PROXIES — comma-separated list of IP addresses or CIDR ranges for reverse proxies. The backend uses these to determine the real client IP.

storageHelp.backupStep1Desc: Use the Database Explorer to export a full SQLite dump, or copy the database file directly from the Docker volume.
storageHelp.backupStep2Desc: Back up the uploads directory. This contains the original files users have uploaded.
storageHelp.backupStep3Desc: Use the Qdrant dashboard or API to create a collection snapshot for your vector data.
storageHelp.backupsDesc: Sanctum stores data in three places — all three should be backed up together for a complete restore.
storageHelp.backupsWhen: Back up regularly, and always before upgrading Sanctum or changing storage paths.
storageHelp.overviewDesc: Storage settings control where Sanctum persists data — the SQLite database, uploaded files, and vector embeddings.
storageHelp.overviewWhen: Adjust these when mounting external volumes, changing backup locations, or connecting to a remote Qdrant instance.
storageHelp.pathsDesc: These paths are inside the Docker container. Map them to host directories using Docker volumes for persistence.
storageHelp.pathsWarning: Changing a path after data has been written will make existing data inaccessible unless you move the files to the new location.
storageHelp.pathsWhen: Set custom paths when using mounted volumes or a non-default directory structure.
storageHelp.qdrantDesc: QDRANT_HOST / QDRANT_PORT — connection to the Qdrant vector database. Defaults to the Qdrant container in the Docker Compose stack.
storageHelp.sqliteDesc: SQLITE_PATH — path to the SQLite database file. Stores users, settings, documents metadata, and encrypted fields.
storageHelp.uploadsDesc: UPLOADS_DIR — directory for uploaded document files. These are the raw files before chunking and embedding.

adminDeployment.testEmailDesc: Send a test email to verify your SMTP settings are working correctly.

upload.title: Upload Documents
upload.subtitle: Add documents to your knowledge base for RAG
upload.dropOrBrowse: Drop file here or click to browse
upload.jobsTimeout: Server is busy processing documents. Try refreshing in a moment.
upload.confirmDeleteDesc: This will permanently remove the document and all its chunks from the knowledge base. This action cannot be undone.

pipelineHelp.chunkedDesc: The document has been split into text chunks. Embedding is in progress or about to start.
pipelineHelp.completedDesc: All chunks are embedded and stored in the vector database. The document is ready for search.
pipelineHelp.failedProcessingFix: Check the backend logs for errors. Common causes: corrupted file, unsupported encoding, or the embedding model is not loaded.
pipelineHelp.formatsDesc: Sanctum accepts the following file types for ingestion into the knowledge base.
pipelineHelp.mdDesc: .md — Markdown files. Headings and structure are preserved during chunking.
pipelineHelp.noChunksFix: The file may be empty, contain only images, or use an encoding the parser cannot read. Try re-saving as UTF-8 plain text.
pipelineHelp.notSupported: Other file types are not currently supported. Convert them to .txt or .md before uploading.
pipelineHelp.pdfDesc: .pdf — PDF documents. Text is extracted; scanned PDFs without OCR text layers may produce empty results.
pipelineHelp.pendingDesc: The document has been uploaded and is waiting in the queue to be processed.
pipelineHelp.pipelineDesc: Documents go through four stages from upload to searchable knowledge. Each stage is shown in the status column.
pipelineHelp.processingDesc: The document is being read, parsed, and split into chunks. This may take a moment for large files.
pipelineHelp.stuckPendingFix: The background worker may not be running. Restart the backend container and check the logs.
pipelineHelp.tipLengthDesc: Very long documents work fine but take longer to process. Consider splitting extremely large files into logical sections.
pipelineHelp.tipNamingDesc: Use descriptive file names — they are shown in search results and help you identify documents later.
pipelineHelp.tipQualityDesc: Clean, well-structured text produces better search results. Remove headers, footers, and boilerplate before uploading.
pipelineHelp.tipsDesc: Get the most out of your knowledge base with these best practices.
pipelineHelp.troubleshootingDesc: Common issues and how to fix them.
pipelineHelp.txtDesc: .txt — Plain text files. The simplest format, works reliably with any content.

llm.label: Maple AI
llm.hint: Sanctum is Maple-only for LLM inference. Configure Maple model/API settings here. Changes require a restart.

embedding.label: Text Processing
embedding.hint: These settings control how your documents are converted into searchable data. The defaults work well for most cases — only change if you're using a custom model.

email.label: Email Service
email.description: Set up email for user authentication
email.hint: Configure email for sending magic links to users during sign-in. You'll need SMTP credentials from an email service like SendGrid, Mailgun, or your own mail server.

storage.label: Data Storage
storage.hint: Control file paths for the database and uploaded documents. These typically don't need to change unless you're customizing your deployment.

security.label: Security & URLs
security.hint: Set your public URLs and security options. The frontend URL is where users access the app. Make sure these match your actual deployment.

search.label: Web Search
search.hint: Configure the search engine that powers the AI's web search feature. When enabled, the AI can look up current information online.

domains.label: Domain & URLs
domains.description: Configure domain names, URLs, and DNS settings
domains.hint: Use these when moving to a custom domain. Defaults assume local development (localhost). Configure your root domain, public URLs, CORS origins, and email DNS records (DKIM/SPF/DMARC).

ssl.label: SSL & Security
ssl.description: Configure SSL certificates and HTTPS settings
ssl.hint: Configure TLS and proxy settings when serving over HTTPS. Defaults are safe for local dev; enable HTTPS only after certificates are mounted.

general.label: General
general.hint: Miscellaneous settings that don't fit into other categories.

prompt_tone.label: Tone & Personality
prompt_tone.description: How the AI should sound when responding
prompt_tone.hint: This sets the overall voice and manner of the AI. For example, you might want it to be "warm and supportive" for a counseling app, or "concise and professional" for a business tool. The AI will use this as guidance for every response.

prompt_rules.label: Behavioral Rules
prompt_rules.description: Specific instructions the AI must follow
prompt_rules.hint: Add rules as a JSON list like ["Always cite sources", "Keep responses under 200 words"]. These are firm guidelines the AI will try to follow in every conversation.

prompt_forbidden.label: Forbidden Topics
prompt_forbidden.description: Topics the AI should decline to discuss
prompt_forbidden.hint: List topics you want the AI to politely redirect away from. For example, ["medical advice", "legal counsel"]. The AI will acknowledge these requests but explain it cannot help with them.

prompt_greeting.label: Response Style
prompt_greeting.description: How the AI structures its responses
prompt_greeting.hint: Controls formatting preferences like whether to use bullet points, headers, or conversational paragraphs. This affects how answers are visually presented.
prompt_greeting.placeholder: Use bullet points for lists, headers for sections...

temperature.label: Creativity Level
temperature.description: How predictable vs. creative the AI responses are
temperature.hint: Lower values (0.0-0.3) make responses more focused and consistent — good for factual Q&A. Higher values (0.7-1.0) make responses more varied and creative — better for brainstorming. Default: 0.7

top_k.label: Knowledge Depth
top_k.description: How many document sections to reference
top_k.hint: When answering questions, the AI searches your uploaded documents and pulls in relevant sections. Higher numbers mean more context but slower responses. Lower numbers are faster but may miss relevant info. Default: 5

web_search_default.label: Web Search
web_search_default.description: Allow AI to search the internet
web_search_default.hint: When enabled, the AI can search the web for current information not in your documents. Disable this if you want responses to only come from your uploaded knowledge base.

LLM_PROVIDER.label: AI Service
LLM_PROVIDER.hint: Maple is the only supported value. This key remains for compatibility.

LLM_MODEL.label: Model Name
LLM_MODEL.hint: The Maple model identifier to use (e.g., "kimi-k2-5").

LLM_API_URL.label: API Endpoint
LLM_API_URL.hint: Maple API base URL. Default: http://maple-proxy:8080/v1.

RAG_TOP_K.label: Context Chunks
RAG_TOP_K.hint: How many document chunks to retrieve for each query. Higher = more context but slower. Default: 8.

PDF_EXTRACT_MODE.label: PDF Processing
PDF_EXTRACT_MODE.hint: "fast" extracts text quickly. "quality" uses OCR for better accuracy with scanned documents but is slower.

EMBEDDING_MODEL.label: Embedding Model
EMBEDDING_MODEL.hint: The HuggingFace model for converting text to vectors. Only change if you need a different language or domain.

SMTP_HOST.label: Mail Server
SMTP_HOST.hint: Your SMTP server address (e.g., smtp.gmail.com, smtp.sendgrid.net).

SMTP_PORT.label: Mail Port
SMTP_PORT.hint: Usually 587 for TLS or 465 for SSL. Check your email provider's settings.

SMTP_USER.label: SMTP Username
SMTP_USER.hint: Your email service username or API key.

SMTP_PASS.label: SMTP Password
SMTP_PASS.hint: Your email service password or API key secret.

SMTP_FROM.label: Sender Address
SMTP_FROM.hint: The "from" address for outgoing emails (e.g., noreply@yourdomain.com).

MOCK_SMTP.label: Test Mode
MOCK_SMTP.hint: When "true", emails are logged instead of sent. Useful for development.

SQLITE_PATH.label: Database File
SQLITE_PATH.hint: Path to the SQLite database file. Default: /data/sanctum.db

UPLOADS_DIR.label: Uploads Folder
UPLOADS_DIR.hint: Directory where uploaded documents are stored. Default: /uploads

QDRANT_HOST.label: Vector DB Host
QDRANT_HOST.hint: Hostname for the Qdrant vector database. Default: qdrant

SEARXNG_URL.label: Search Engine URL
SEARXNG_URL.hint: URL of your SearXNG instance for web search functionality.

FRONTEND_URL.label: App URL
FRONTEND_URL.hint: The public URL where users access the app. Used for generating magic links.

SIMULATE_USER_AUTH.label: Simulate User Auth
SIMULATE_USER_AUTH.description: Allow user verification without magic link token (testing only)
SIMULATE_USER_AUTH.hint: Enable for development/testing. Allows users to complete email verification without clicking the magic link. Should be disabled in production.

SIMULATE_ADMIN_AUTH.label: Simulate Admin Auth
SIMULATE_ADMIN_AUTH.description: Show mock Nostr connection button for admin auth (testing only)
SIMULATE_ADMIN_AUTH.hint: Enable for development/testing. Shows a "Mock Connection" button on admin login that bypasses Nostr extension requirement. Should be disabled in production.

BASE_DOMAIN.label: Root Domain
BASE_DOMAIN.hint: Root domain without protocol. Example: example.com. Leave blank for local dev.

INSTANCE_URL.label: Application URL
INSTANCE_URL.hint: Public app URL with protocol. Example: https://app.example.com. Default: http://localhost:5173.

API_BASE_URL.label: API URL
API_BASE_URL.hint: Only set if API is on a separate domain. Example: https://api.example.com. Default: http://localhost:8000.

ADMIN_BASE_URL.label: Admin URL
ADMIN_BASE_URL.hint: Only if admin UI is on a separate domain. Example: https://admin.example.com. Default: http://localhost:5173/admin.

EMAIL_DOMAIN.label: Email Domain
EMAIL_DOMAIN.hint: Domain used for From addresses and DNS records. Example: example.com or mail.example.com.

DKIM_SELECTOR.label: DKIM Selector
DKIM_SELECTOR.hint: Selector prefix for your DKIM TXT record. Default: sanctum. Your provider may require a specific selector.

SPF_INCLUDE.label: SPF Include
SPF_INCLUDE.hint: Replace with your provider include value (e.g., include:sendgrid.net, include:_spf.google.com).

DMARC_POLICY.label: DMARC Policy
DMARC_POLICY.hint: Start with v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:dmarc@example.com and tighten later.

CORS_ORIGINS.label: CORS Origins
CORS_ORIGINS.hint: Comma-separated full origins (scheme + host). Example: https://app.example.com,https://admin.example.com. Default: http://localhost:5173.

CDN_DOMAINS.label: CDN Domains
CDN_DOMAINS.hint: Comma-separated CDN hostnames for static assets (e.g., cdn.example.com). Leave blank if not using a CDN.

CUSTOM_SEARXNG_URL.label: Custom SearXNG URL
CUSTOM_SEARXNG_URL.hint: Set only if using a separate SearXNG host. Example: https://search.example.com.

WEBHOOK_BASE_URL.label: Webhook URL
WEBHOOK_BASE_URL.hint: Base URL used to construct webhook callbacks. Example: https://api.example.com/webhooks. Default: http://localhost:8000.

TRUSTED_PROXIES.label: Trusted Proxies
TRUSTED_PROXIES.hint: Set to cloudflare, aws, or a comma-separated list of IP ranges. Leave blank if not behind a proxy.

SSL_CERT_PATH.label: SSL Certificate Path
SSL_CERT_PATH.hint: Absolute path to the certificate file. Example: /etc/ssl/certs/fullchain.pem.

SSL_KEY_PATH.label: SSL Key Path
SSL_KEY_PATH.hint: Absolute path to the private key file. Example: /etc/ssl/private/privkey.pem.

FORCE_HTTPS.label: Force HTTPS
FORCE_HTTPS.hint: Set to true only after SSL_CERT_PATH and SSL_KEY_PATH are configured.

HSTS_MAX_AGE.label: HSTS Max Age
HSTS_MAX_AGE.hint: Seconds browsers should enforce HTTPS. Default: 31536000 (1 year). Use 0 to disable.

MONITORING_URL.label: Monitoring URL
MONITORING_URL.hint: Health check URL for external monitors. Default: http://localhost:8000/health.

LLM_API_KEY.label: API Key
LLM_API_KEY.hint: Maps to MAPLE_API_KEY. Leave empty to clear override and use .env fallback.

promptPreview.sampleQuestion: What should I know about this topic?

after.body: Your Sanctum instance is set up and ready. You can now configure settings, upload documents, and start querying your knowledge base.
after.note: Use a trusted device — your Nostr key is used to encrypt and decrypt sensitive instance data.
after.title: You're all set!

instanceInitiation.statusError: Unable to reach the backend. Make sure all services are running.

step1.body: This instance has no admin yet. The first person to connect becomes the owner.
step1.feature1Desc: Your Nostr identity is the master key. No passwords, no email — just your key pair.
step1.feature2Desc: The first person to sign in becomes the admin with full control over settings and data.
step1.feature3Desc: Manage users, configure AI models, upload documents, and control every aspect of your instance.
step1.label: Welcome
step1.title: Claim your Sanctum

step2.body: Sanctum uses Nostr (NIP-07) for authentication. You'll need a browser extension that manages your Nostr keys.
step2.flow1: Open your Nostr extension (Alby, nos2x, etc.)
step2.flow3: Your public key is registered as admin
step2.label: Authenticate
step2.title: Sign in with Nostr

step3.body: Click the button below to sign in and claim this instance. This will register your public key as the admin.
step3.label: Connect
step3.title: Ready to connect

instanceInitiation.subtitle: Set up your private knowledge base in a few steps.
instanceInitiation.title: Welcome to Sanctum

extracted.select_u_s_created_at_from_users_u_729d1: SELECT u.*, s.created_at FROM users u JOIN sessions s ON u.id = s.user_id;
